clinical_study.brief_title: Fluorescent Thoracoscopy Used in Surgery for Palmar Hyperhidrosis
clinical_study.official_title: Fluorescent Thoracoscopy Used in Surgery for Palmar Hyperhidrosis

brief_summary.textblock: T3/T4 endoscopic thoracic sympathicotomy is a widely accepted and effective treatment for primary palmar hyperhidrosis. However, sympathetic ganglions are invisible with traditional thoracoscopy and until now, the location of ganglions are confirmed by rib indirectly. The team from thoracic department of Peking University People's Hospital discovered that the sympathetic ganglions can be visualized with fluorescent thoracoscopy. Thus, investigators want to apply fluorescent thoracoscopy in sympathicotomy of palmar hyperhidrosis, to conduct a more precise operation and compare the efficiency of the novel and traditional methods.

primary_outcome.measure: Anatomical variation of the sympathetic ganglions
primary_outcome.description: Record the spatial relationship between sympathetic ganglions and ribs, for example: T3/R4 represents the T3 sympathetic ganglion is located on the 4th rib.

secondary_outcome.description: Use questionnaire including 3 descriptive names of scale ( over dry, comfortable and wet) to record the surgical effect on palmar sweating.
Use questionnaire including 4 descriptive names of scale ( none, mild, moderate and severe) to record the side effect (compensatory hyperhidrosis) of this surgery.

arm_group.description: VATS R4 Sympathicotomy performed on all patients. Fluorescent thoracoscopy was used to identify the shifting mode of sympathetic ganglions.

intervention.description: Sympathicotomy performed by near-infrared imaging thoracoscopy

study_pop.textblock: patients suffering from primary palmar hyperhidrosis

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Diagnosed with primary palmar hyperhydrosis.
2. Accept surgical treatment and signed informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Liver dysfunction.
2. Allergic to indocyanine green.
3. Can't tolerate thoracoscopic surgery.
